Hi Martin, could you provide a little more info on what you mean by seque=
nce learning?  Do you mean evolving a network to perform a sequence of acti=
ons, or perhaps evolving a network that learns a sequence during its lifeti=
me, or something else (such as learning the predict the next value in a seq=
uence)?

ken

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "martin_pyka" <martin.pyka@...> =
wrote:
>
> I would ask the community for good sequence learning problems th=
at can be used to train neural networks. I think, a maze-navigation problem=
 is probably a good starting point to study sequence learning. But what oth=
er problems have been used in the literature to study sequence learning?
> =

> Best,
> Martin
>
